summary.para: Contains types related to the Gantt control.
Contains base types that specify a workweek schedule in the Gantt control.
Represents a base rule for exceptions to the regular workweek schedule.

summary.para: Returns whether the rules includes the specified date.

member.param: A date to check whether the rule includes it.
member.returns: true, if the rule includes the specified date; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Enumerates modes that specify whether the task list or chart width is fixed when the user resizes the control.
The chart width is fixed.
The mode is not specified explicitly. Enables the None mode.
None width is fixed. The task list and diagram change their widths proportionally.
The task list width is fixed.
Enumerates modes that specify whether the task list, chart, or both are visible.
The task list and chart are visible.
The chart is visible. The task list is hidden.
The mode is not specified explicitly. Enables the Both mode.
The task list is visible. The chart is hidden.
Provides data for the event.

summary.para: Enumerates values that specify time intervals that correspond to a single unit on the time scale.
A single unit corresponds to a day.
A single unit corresponds to a half of the year.
A single unit corresponds to an hour.
A single unit corresponds to a millisecond.
A single unit corresponds to a minute.
A single unit corresponds to a month.
A single unit corresponds to a quarter of the year.
A single unit corresponds to a second.
A single unit corresponds to a week.
A single unit corresponds to a year.
Enumerates values that specify how the scale changes when a user scrolls the mouse wheel.
The actual mode is not explicitly specified. Enables the Smooth mode.
Switches to the next measure unit (week, month, quarter, etc.) by each wheel step.
First decreases the size of a single division to a certain limit and then switches to the next measure unit (week, month, quarter, etc.).

summary.para: Contains types that specify a workweek schedule in the Gantt control.
Enumerates months.
April
August
December
February
January
July
June
March
May
November
October
September
Enumerates week numbers in a month.
The first week.
The forth week.
The last week.
The second week.
The third week.
Represents a single time interval in a day's schedule (for example, 9:00 to 12:00).
